title: Async AMQP Driver
description:
The Async AMQP component enables the AMQP driver for the Async functionality.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/async/amqp/

host.title: Host
host.description:
The connection string, ends in slash.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/async/amqp/

exchange.title: Exchange
exchange.description:
The exchange name (must have a topic type if already exists).

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/async/amqp/

durable.title: Durable
durable.description:
true is recommended, but depends on the use case. Durable queues will survive server restarts and remain when there are no remaining consumers or bindings.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/async/amqp/

delete.title: Delete
delete.description:
false is recommended to avoid deletions when the consumer is disconnected.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/async/amqp/

exclusive.title: Exclusive
exclusive.description:
true if only this consumer can access the queue.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/async/amqp/

no_wait.title: No wait
no_wait.description:
When true, do not wait for the server to confirm the request and immediately begin deliveries. If it is not possible to consume, a channel exception will be raised and the channel will be closed.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/async/amqp/

no_local.title: No local
no_local.description:
The no_local flag is not supported by RabbitMQ.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/async/amqp/

prefetch_count.title: Prefetch count
prefetch_count.description:
The number of messages you want to prefetch prior to consume them.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/async/amqp/

prefetch_size.title: Prefetch size
prefetch_size.description:
The number of bytes you want to use to prefetch messages.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/async/amqp/

auto_ack.title: Auto ACK
auto_ack.description:
When KrakenD retrieves the messages, regardless of the success or failure of the operation, it marks them as ACK. Defaults to false.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/async/amqp/
